Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for storage capacity, performance, scalability, and redundancy. Identify the applications and workloads that will use Azure Elastic SAN.
Design the storage architecture, including the placement of Elastic SAN volumes, integration with existing Azure resources, and redundancy configurations.
Create and configure the Elastic SAN resource in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Ensure proper allocation of storage pools and volumes.
Set up access controls and permissions for the Elastic SAN resource. Ensure only authorized users and applications can access the storage.
Enable encryption for data at rest and in transit. Configure encryption keys and policies to secure the storage environment.
Set up integration with Azure Backup or other backup solutions to ensure data protection and recovery capabilities.
Perform thorough testing of storage performance, including IOPS, throughput, and latency measurements to ensure the setup meets the required specifications.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and other tools. Configure alerts for storage capacity, performance metrics, and error conditions.
Document the storage architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Provide detailed instructions for managing and troubleshooting the Elastic SAN setup.
Ensure the storage setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
